definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: This carriage has a seating capacity of 120 people.
Find out how much your surveyor's and solicitor's fees will be.
sentences.chinese: 弄清你要向鑑定員和律師支付多少費用。

sentences.english: Trials to set the allowable number of employees, level of funding and limits for spending for goods within basic expenditures expanded.
sentences.chinese: 擴大基本支出定員定額和實物費用定額試點。

sentences.english: The first group will consist of 600 people and currently the number of applicants has exceeded 300.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮遊首發團定員600人，目前報名人數已經過半。

sentences.english: At last the English Department has its full complement of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 英語系的教師定員終於滿額了。

sentences.english: And I served some of them to trained oil judges.
sentences.chinese: 我還讓訓練有素的食用油鑑定員嚐了嚐。

sentences.english: The first group will consist of 600 people and currently the number of applicants has surpassed half.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮遊首發團定員600人，目前報名人數已經過半。

sentences.english: Establishes fixed quantity standard system which the fixed member fixed quantity and the real asset unify.
sentences.chinese: 建立定員定額與實物資產相結合的定額標準體系。

sentences.english: In 1902 he went to work as a patent office examiner in Bern .
sentences.chinese: 1902年他到伯恩當上了專利局的鑑定員。

definition: preparedness/to bring sth to a state of readiness
